Charizard.overview: The tier is still in its infancy and the metagame develops with each passing day. The sample set(s) provided below will be regularly updated until proper analyses are in the works. See it as a rough outline to get started and accustomed to what sets are commonly used.

sets.name: Bulky Bulk Up
sets.description: 16 Speed EVs with a Jolly nature is to outspeed Frosmoth and Modest Toxtricity.

sets.name: Imposter
sets.description: Tera Steel makes Ditto immune to Toxic Spikes and take less from Stealth Rock. It also lets Ditto revenge kill Belly Drum Hariyama. A Quiet nature and the Special Attack investment is in case Ditto transforms into a Future Sight user like Slowbro.

sets.name: Choice Specs
sets.description: 52 Speed EVs are to outspeed Bellibolt. Tera Fairy Tera Blast is used to hit Dragon-types such as Goodra.

sets.name: Specially Defensive
sets.description: Overcoat is an option over Filter so Venomoth can't try to muscle past a weakened Revavroom with Sleep Powder and enough sleep turns.

sets.name: Shift Gear
sets.description: Tera Ground covers Steel- and Fire-types such as Klefki, Coalossal, and Paldean Tauros-F, but Tera Fire can be used for Bronzong.

sets.name: Slush Rush Sweeper
sets.description: The Speed EVs are to outrun +2 neutral natured Toxtricity. With 60 Defense EVs, Cetitan under snow survives Paldean Tauros-F's Close Combat even after Belly Drum.

Tatsugiri.overview: The tier is still in its infancy and the metagame develops with each passing day. The sample set(s) provided below will be regularly updated until proper analyses are in the works. See it as a rough outline to get started and accustomed to what sets are commonly used.

sets.name: Offensive Spinner
sets.description: Despite having no effect in singles, Commander is used so Gardevoir can't Trace Storm Drain and wall Tatsugiri. Tera Steel turns the tide on Fairy-types such as Gardevoir and Sylveon. It also helps against Cryogonal's Freeze Dry.
